net.amoebaman.utils
Class S_Loc

java.lang.Object
  net.amoebaman.utils.S_Loc

public class S_Loc
extends java.lang.Object

Contains static methods for converting and reverting Locations to and from easily serializable and saveable forms.

Author:
AmoebaMan

Constructor Detail

S_Loc

public S_Loc()
Method Detail

configSave

public static void configSave(org.bukkit.Location loc,
                              org.bukkit.configuration.ConfigurationSection config,
                              boolean includeRotation)
Saves a location into a ConfigurationSection, optionally including the rotational data.

Rotational data can take up quite a bit more room than just coordinates, and isn't even used unless you're teleporting a player to a location. If you're not storing a location with teleportation in mind, you should probably not include rotation data.

After saving a location using this method, it can be loaded by using configLoad(ConfigurationSection).

Parameters:
loc - a location
config - the configuration section to store the location in
includeRotation - whether or not to include the yaw and pitch data

configLoad

public static org.bukkit.Location configLoad(org.bukkit.configuration.ConfigurationSection config)
Loads a previously-saved location from a ConfigurationSection. If any portions of the location's data are missing from the config, they'll be replaced by their respective components from the location world@(0.5, 64.5, 0.5, 0.0, 0.0).

Parameters:
config - a configuration section
Returns:
the location previously stored

stringSave

public static java.lang.String stringSave(org.bukkit.Location loc,
                                          boolean round,
                                          boolean rotation)
Compresses a Location into a String, allowing it to be easily saved and recalled later, optionally including the rotational data.

Rotational data can take up quite a bit more room than just coordinates, and isn't even used unless you're teleporting a player to a location. If you're not storing a location with teleportation in mind, you should probably not include rotation data.

The saved string will be of the format [world]@([x],[y],[z],[yaw],[pitch]).

After saving a location using this method, it can be loaded by using #stringLoad(Location)

Parameters:
loc - a location
round - whether or not to snap to even coordinates
rotation - whether or not to include the yaw and pitch data
Returns:
a string containing the location's data

stringLoad

public static org.bukkit.Location stringLoad(java.lang.String str)
Loads a previously-saved location from a string saved using #stringSave(Location, boolean). If the string is improperly formatted, this method will return null;

Parameters:
str - a location string
round - whether or not to automatically snap the location to block centers (usually for nice teleportation)
Returns:
the location saved, or null if the string is improperly formatted

toString

public static java.lang.String toString(org.bukkit.Location loc)
Gets a nice, friendly bit of text to represent a Location. The string is formatted as "([x], [y], [z]) in [world]".

Parameters:
loc - a location
Returns:
a friendly string
